page.title: 13COUNTRY LIFE
page.content: COUNTRY LIFE. The beauty and peace of the rural surroundings do not disguise many of the problems of country life.The lack of facilities, particularly shops is a major problem, particularly for the elderly or those who do not own a car.The nearest shops are in Yate,5miles away, but a fishmonger calls once a week,a baker twice weekly and a general store daily. A mobile library pays a weekly visit. Most shopping for clothes, furniture etc is done either in Bristol or Bath. The children go to Chipping Sodbury to school,the nearer school at Wapley closed down a few years ago. From the more prosperous homes the children go to boarding schools. Like the elderly ,the children's lives are restricted by their lack of mobility.
